feed.title: Indie Hackers Interviews
feed.subtitle: Interviews with the hackers behind profitable apps and businesses.

entry.title: Toolwatch.io - Measure the Accuracy of Your Watch ($4000/mo)
entry.summary: Marc Montagne explains how he built Toolwatch.io and grew revenue to $4,000/mo by going to market with nearly a dozen user outreach methods.

entry.title: Tettra - Simple Company Wiki for Slack Teams ($25000/mo)
entry.summary: Tettra generates $25,000/mo providing wikis to company Slack teams. Nelson Joyce explains how they pivoted and found traction after a rocky release of version one.

entry.title: Dependabot - Automated Dependency Updates ($740/mo)
entry.summary: Grey Baker explains how he and his co-founder have built and grown Dependabot to $740/mo by living off their savings and capitalizing on early user feedback.

entry.title: Widgetic - Apps as a Service for DIY Platforms ($3270/mo)
entry.summary: Andu Potorac and his team pivoted from digital agency to SaaS company. Read how they've used subscriptions, partnerships, and integrations to generate over $3k/mo.

entry.title: Yet Another Mail Merge - Easy Mail Merge with Gmail ($70000/mo)
entry.summary: Romain Vialard's Yet Another Mail Merge attracts over 100,000 monthly users and generates $70,000/mo — all through organic growth methods. Read how.

entry.title: Resume Beacon - Resume Builder, Resume Templates ($500/mo)
entry.summary: Paul Dessert explains how he's grown templating app Resume Beacon to $500/mo as part of a personal challenge to build multiple revenue-generating products.

entry.title: CoderPad - Interviewing Platform for Programmers ($170000/mo)
entry.summary: Vincent Woo's online interviewing platform CoderPad brings in $170,000/mo. Read how he built it and made ordinary sales calls to find his first customers.

entry.title: JungleFlip - Deal Finding, Discounted Products ($550/mo)
entry.summary: Paul Dessert explains how he built JungleFlip and grew revenue to $550/mo. After originally focusing on the wrong audience, he experimented and cast a wider net.

entry.title: Kapwing - Online Video Editor and Meme Maker ($240/mo)
entry.summary: Kapwing is profitable, and it's only a couple months old. Julia Enthoven explains how her team has channeled their love of social media into a promising business.

entry.title: Snipcart - Easy, Flexible E-Commerce for Developers ($33000/mo)
entry.summary: Snipcart generates $33,000/mo helping developers add e-commerce features to their websites. Franck Lanthier Nadeau explains how.

entry.title: Find-me - Connecting Advertisers with Creators ($250/mo)
entry.summary: Erik Rood explains how he's grown a service for advertisers to $250/mo in just two months by reaching out to one client at a time.

entry.title: Baby Growth Chart Percentile - App for New Parents ($100/mo)
entry.summary: Min Kwon built an iOS app for new parents, and in three months he's grown it to almost $200/mo. Read how he got started and how he's found his audience.

entry.title: Quail - Point of Sale for Antique Malls ($900/mo)
entry.summary: Trevor Fountain explains how Quail — a point-of-sale SaaS business for retailers — makes $900/mo, even though most of his customers have no online presence.

entry.title: Space Jam Data - Commercial Real Estate Analytics ($25000/mo)
entry.summary: Space Jam Data, a B2B real estate crowdsourcing tool, generates $25,000/mo. Jack Clancy explains why it pays to build relationships with every potential customer.

entry.title: PremiumCoding - WordPress Themes for Blogs ($15000/mo)
entry.summary: Website theme marketplaces are very competitive. Read how the PremiumCoding ($15k/mo) founders have leveraged multiple 3rd-party platforms to stay ahead.

entry.title: Trump Excel - Community for Excel Enthusiasts ($4500/mo)
entry.summary: Sumit Bansal explains how he turned his experience working with Excel spreadsheets into a profitable online community business generating $4,500/mo.

entry.title: Grid Sage Games - Niche Tactical Games ($2500/mo)
entry.summary: Josh Ge was a hobbyist game developer for more than ten years. Read how he has grown his audience, and how his newest game, Cogmind, generates $2,500/mo.

entry.title: Society Socks - E-Commerce Sock Subscription ($6000/mo)
entry.summary: Filip Pejic's e-commerce company makes $6k/mo. He explains how he staged a viral launch and how he regained momentum after a post-launch slowdown in traffic.

entry.title: EditionGuard - eBook Anti-Piracy Solutions ($25000/mo)
entry.summary: Turgay Birand spent thousands to acquire his first ten customers. He explains how this investment paid off, helping him grown his SaaS app to $25,000/mo.

entry.title: Postcard Panda - Eco-Friendly Postcards ($400/mo)
entry.summary: When Matt Sencenbaugh learned about a VC-funded postcard app, he challenged himself to bootstrap his own version. Read how he generates hundreds in revenue.

entry.title: Inbox When Ready - Chrome Extension for Gmail ($1200/mo)
entry.summary: Peter Hartree was getting distracted by his email, so he built a Chrome extension to protect his focus. Now his side project is making $1,200/mo.

entry.title: Bubble - Visual Programming ($100000/mo)
entry.summary: Everyone wants to code, but not everyone knows how. Read how two co-founders built and grew a solution to this problem which now generates $100,000/mo.

entry.title: Payfunnels - Invoicing App ($10000/mo)
entry.summary: Dave Rogenmoser explains how he built Payfunnels to address his own needs, grew it with the help of online courses, and ultimately sold the company in 2017.

entry.title: BotList, Inc. - Connecting Humans to Bots ($200/mo)
entry.summary: Seth Louey, a former nominee for Product Hunt Maker of the Year, explains how he and his co-founder capitalized on a growing tech trend to build a community.

entry.title: Snappies - A Whole New Kind Of Snapback ($1500/mo)
entry.summary: Burly Vinson explains how he's grown his ecommerce business to $1,500/mo in under a year after starting from zero: no dev experience, no online following.

entry.title: everydayCheck - Simple and Beautiful Habit Tracker ($450/mo)
entry.summary: Joan Boixadós's everydayCheck began as a goal for January: "Make a project that makes at least $1." Half a year later, the project brings in $450/mo. Read how.

entry.title: Tech Press List - 100 Journalist Contacts for Your Startup ($620/mo)
entry.summary: Pete MacLeod started Tech Press List ($620/mo) just two months ago while working a full-time job. Read how's he validated and built a profitable project with no code.

entry.title: Hercules - Workout Performance Tracker App ($3000/mo)
entry.summary: Jérémy Mouzin couldn't find a suitable workout app, so he built his own: Hercules, $3,000/mo. Read his paint-by-numbers system for driving traffic to a mobile app.

entry.title: RunCloud.io - A Modern Web Server Panel ($2800/mo)
entry.summary: Developers are notoriously hard to sell to. Arif Tukiman's team hedged on this risk by building for themselves first, then targeting a niche. Today they make $2.8k/mo.

entry.title: WeddingLovely - Wedding Planning App & Vendor Network ($7200/mo)
entry.summary: Designer Tracy Osborn couldn't find a developer to help with her business idea, so she built a scaled-down website herself. Today, WeddingLovely generates $7.2k/mo.

entry.title: The Lobby - Stop Wasting Time Applying to Jobs ($2000/mo)
entry.summary: Deepak Chhugani found a lot to be desired in the recruiting practices of investment banks. Today his company makes $2,000/mo disrupting these practices. Read how.

entry.title: Timetastic - A Nicer Way to Book Time Off Work ($28000/mo)
entry.summary: The original Timetastic was a side project for internal use by a separate company. Read how Gary Bury grew it into a mature business of its own, making $28k/mo.

entry.title: Jitbit Software - SaaS Help Desk ($160000/mo)
entry.summary: Alex Yumashev's self-funded help desk service makes $1,700,000 per year. Read how he uses "viral tools" (rather than, say, viral blog posts) to attract new users.

entry.title: PongUp! - Office Ping Pong Leaderboard ($300/mo)
entry.summary: At $300/mo in its fourth month, Dennis Ong's PongUp! shows that fun and profit can mix. Read about the pre-launch efforts that helped him hit the ground running.

entry.title: Dollar Flight Club - Travel, Cheap Flights, Adventure ($1500/mo)
entry.summary: After life-changing experiences abroad, Jesse Neugarten built and launched Dollar Flight Club. Read how he's found users and grown revenue to $1,500 in half a year.

entry.title: Officelovin’ - The Best Tech and Startup Offices ($3000/mo)
entry.summary: Michal Ptacek has followed the money. Tech companies know that stunning office spaces attract top talent, so Michal has built an office showcase making $3,000/mo.

entry.title: Demio - Smart Webinar Platform ($43000/mo)
entry.summary: Feature creep almost sank the first version of Demio. Read how Wyatt Jozwowski and his team narrowed their focus to the core product to grow revenue to 43k/mo.

entry.title: Vacayrx - Alternative Vacation Rental Platform ($7500/mo)
entry.summary: Jesse Martinek bootstrapped Vacayrx with a bit of in-the-field market validation and no web development background. Read how he's grown it to $7,500/mo.

entry.title: Stay22 - Accommodation Service for Eventgoers ($5000/mo)
entry.summary: Hamed Al-Khabaz explains the clever marketing and product validation that have helped him rapidly grow Stay22, a hotel accommodation service, to $5,000/mo.

entry.title: Content Snare - Get Content From Your Clients ($960/mo)
entry.summary: James Rose details each facet of Content Snare's multifaceted marketing strategy to explain how the SaaS company has grown to $960/mo.

entry.title: Worldwide101 - Premium Virtual Assistant Company ($200000/mo)
entry.summary: After years of full-time work, Sandra Lewis began to consult for entrepreneurs. Then she expanded. Read how she's grown it into a multi-million dollar business.

entry.title: I Want That Flight - Airfare Comparison Website ($110000/mo)
entry.summary: Serial maker Garth Adams got into the cheap flights business back in 2002, and over that period he's grown revenue from 20 cents per day to $110,000 per month.

entry.title: MH Themes - Professional Magazine WordPress Themes ($30000/mo)
entry.summary: Michael Hebenstreit left his equity trading career behind to build a WordPress business. Today, he's making $30,000/mo, but it hasn't been an easy path.

entry.title: Get Me To Europe - Cheapest Flights to Europe ($100/mo)
entry.summary: Neither Nicholas Romano nor his co-founder Kyle Hetherington are programmers, yet their startup is on track to make hundreds in its second month. Read how.

entry.title: Populum - Direct-To-Consumer Supplement Brand ($70000/mo)
entry.summary: Hemp oil business Populum is less than a year old, yet it's generating $70,000/mo. Read how the founders are breaking the rules of convention in a taboo industry.

entry.title: Founder2be - Online Dating for Co-founders ($2000/mo)
entry.summary: Oliver Bremer couldn't find a co-founder, so he turned his problem into an opportunity worth $2,000/mo — Founder2be: online dating for co-founders.

entry.title: BlankPage - Motivation as a Service for Writers ($1300/mo)
entry.summary: Jesper Bylund tells the story behind his storytelling business. Read how he's kept ahead of the competition, adapted to new tech, and upped revenue to $1,300/mo.

entry.title: rmotr.com - Remote Programming Bootcamp ($17000/mo)
entry.summary: After failing to find customers at a previous startup, the rmotr.com team set a valuable constraint for themselves: no code until the idea is validated by users.

entry.title: Chessable - Science-based Chess Education ($6000/mo)
entry.summary: David Kramaley's chess education site makes $6,000/mo. Read how he's partnered with professionals and bucked conventional wisdom on chess learning to get here.

entry.title: Nick Janetakis - Developer and Teacher ($5000/mo)
entry.summary: Nick Janetakis' online courses bring in $5,000/mo. Here, he gives a crash course on what it takes to produce the courses — and to run the business that gives them life.

entry.title: Practical Golf - Honest Coaching for Golfers ($3000/mo)
entry.summary: Jon Sherman explains how his self-published book, like other online products, had to be tailored to solve the problems of a niche audience to get to #1 on Amazon.

entry.title: Double Your Freelancing - Business Training for Freelancers ($78000/mo)
entry.summary: How do you sell SaaS products without an audience? Brennan Dunn's quest for an answer led him away from SaaS itself and to a $78,000/mo business selling insights.

entry.title: GoDesignerGo - Flat-rate, Unlimited Graphic Design ($1500/mo)
entry.summary: Andrew Elliott, who runs a design shop making $1,500/mo, discusses his unusual business model and the transition from wantrepreneur to entrepreneur.

entry.title: Ridj-it - Carpool Your Way to Adventure ($1000/mo)
entry.summary: "Carpool business" almost sounds like an oxymoron. The founders of Ridj-it explain the clever marketing they've used to break new ground in an untapped industry.

entry.title: Punchpass - Fitness Studio Business Software ($27000/mo)
entry.summary: Chris Patton found a problem at a local fitness business and started with a simple solution. He's since grown it to over $27k/mo with clients in over 50 countries.

entry.title: ProteusThemes - WordPress Themes for Small Businesses ($16000/mo)
entry.summary: Copycats turned the early success of Primož Cigler's WordPress business into a liability. Read how he's rebounded by changing his strategy — and even his role.

entry.title: Sidebar - Daily Newsletter of Design Links ($3000/mo)
entry.summary: In 2012, Sacha Greif created a newsletter to drive traffic to another product. Today, the newsletter makes $3k/mo and is his main source of revenue. Read how he did it.

entry.title: ArkServers.io - Game Server Hosting ($20000/mo)
entry.summary: Sergey Tsalkov's hosting business makes $20,000/mo and has been growing by 8% per week. Learn how he has found what he calls a "ready-made audience."

entry.title: ClusterEngine - MySQL and MariaDB as a Service ($20000/mo)
entry.summary: Dmitry Ivanov explains how a pivot in his product offering and trial and error with marketing and user onboarding have helped him grow his revenue to $20,000/mo.

entry.title: Examine.com - Nutrition and Supplement Database ($100000/mo)
entry.summary: Sol Orwell explains how he's grown his site into a 7-figure business by becoming the definitive resource in a field where there used to be more questions than answers.

entry.title: DSM Website Plugins - Social Media Website Plugins ($2000/mo)
entry.summary: Mike Dalisay explains how he has used his coding blog to validate and attract users to his social media plugins, which now bring in $2,000 a month.

entry.title: Bugfender - Cloud Storage for Your App Logs ($6500/mo)
entry.summary: Stefan Klumpp explains how his team of developers turned their own internal tool into a SaaS product for developers. It now brings in $6,500/mo.

entry.title: Matboard and More - E-commerce Store for Mats and Frames ($170000/mo)
entry.summary: Mehdi Kajbaf explains how his brothers have divided the work of engineering, industry knowledge, and marketing to grow their business to $170,000 a month.

entry.title: Publer - Your Facebook's Superhero ($3000/mo)
entry.summary: Ervin Kalemi explains how he turned his side project into a business generating $3,000/mo by marketing broadly across several social media and startup channels.

entry.title: Disrupt Cards - Cards Against Humanity for Startups ($1500/mo)
entry.summary: Jordan Gonen explains how his team has grown their card game business to $1,500/mo (without paid marketing!) through scrappy engagement with their niche.

entry.title: Epic Plugins and Themes - Premium WordPress Plugins and Themes ($5000/mo)
entry.summary: Michael Stott explains how the learnings of a failed side project — coupled with creative marketing — have helped him grow his WordPress business to $5,000/mo.

entry.title: Sourced Adventures - Adventure Travel Startup ($125000/mo)
entry.summary: Kyle Davidson explains how he identified consumer demand before before building his travel service in order to grow the startup to $125,000/mo.

entry.title: Shoppe - Social E-commerce for Boutiques ($120000/mo)
entry.summary: Ryan Frahm explains how he and his wife leveraged the power of word-of-mouth referrals to grow their platform for sellers to $120,000/mo.

entry.title: Kernl - Premium WordPress Updates ($550/mo)
entry.summary: Jack Slingerland explains how he's grown his side project to $550/mo by shipping fast and reaching out to new customers when his competitors drop the ball.

entry.title: Flystein - Human-Powered Flight Search Service ($8000/mo)
entry.summary: Roman Kalyakin explains how he's used data-driven marketing campaigns and industry knowledge to grow his flight hacking business to $8,000/mo.

entry.title: Crowdraising - Next-Gen Crowdsourcing ($500/mo)
entry.summary: Naveen Mishra talks about working with his co-founder to clarify their messaging and get their novel "crowdraising" business idea off the ground.

entry.title: Review Signal - Web Hosting Reviews ($3000/mo)
entry.summary: Solo founder Kevin Ohashi built a review service that generates $3,000/mo by shifting most of his attention to marketing and building trust in a cynical market.

entry.title: Sneez - eCommerce Social Selling Automation ($600/mo)
entry.summary: Tom Hunt explains how he used Facebook groups to find his first 20 paying subscribers within two months of launching his new business.

entry.title: Felix - Autopay for Freelancers ($100/mo)
entry.summary: Thomas Howell got tired of manually invoicing his clients, so he built and launched a payment system to automate the entire process. Here's how he did it.

entry.title: Site Builder Report - Website Builder Reviews ($44000/mo)
entry.summary: Instead of struggling to stand out in a crowded marketplace, Steve Benjamins took advantage of the competition and built a review site that makes over $40,000/mo.

entry.title: BuildMyEmails - Email Marketing Simplified ($1500/mo)
entry.summary: Co-founders Shevon and Chris explain how they found a valuable gap in the market, hired some development help, and grew revenue to $1,500/mo.

entry.title: Free Vector Maps - Free Vector Maps ($2000/mo)
entry.summary: Ted Grajeda explains how he's grown his niche mapping business to $2,000 a month by focusing on SEO and targeting customers at a global scale.

entry.title: Scott's Cheap Flights - Cheap Flights Subscription Service ($320000/mo)
entry.summary: Scott and Brian explain how they grew a small side project into a booming businesses with over 600,000 subscribers and $4 million in annual revenue.

entry.title: Gourmet Pup Club - Dog Treat Subscription Service ($800/mo)
entry.summary: Learn how Ansel Ponce Diama engaged in brute-force marketing tactics to validate his idea and build up an email list of 1,000 subscribers in his first month.

entry.title: Intrinio - Financial Data and Analytics Market ($10000/mo)
entry.summary: Learn how Intrinio's mission to stay scrappy, affordable, and approachable has helped them develop a freemium product that reaches thousands of customers.

entry.title: Mailbird - Unifies All Online Communications ($60000/mo)
entry.summary: Mohammad Dimas explains how he and his team grew their app to $60,000 a month by filling a gap in the Windows platform and quickly going to market.

entry.title: Baremetrics - Revenue Analytics Platform ($83000/mo)
entry.summary: Learn how Josh Pigford identified a valuable pain point for businesses, rapidly iterated on his early product, went on to grow revenue to over $80,000/month.

entry.title: QuickDraw - Affiliate Marketing Reporting ($1500/mo)
entry.summary: Heath Bertini explains how a problem at work led to a product idea, and how he partnered with a developer to turn it into a profitable side project.

entry.title: GifShare - Instagram Gif Editor ($10000/mo)
entry.summary: Rob Caraway explains how he carefully conducted market research to find and validate an idea for a suite of mobile apps that netted him over $240,000.

entry.title: ThemeIsle - Freemium WordPress Themes ($50000/mo)
entry.summary: Ionut Neagu created a WordPress themes site that makes $50,000/month. Learn how his past failures and dogged persistence helped him get to this point.

entry.title: Angular on Rails - Teaching Angular to Rails Developers ($745/mo)
entry.summary: Jason Swett explains how he identified an underdocumented technical topic, became an expert, and turned his knowledge into an eBook that makes $750/mo.

entry.title: Offscreen Magazine - Magazine About Tech People ($10000/mo)
entry.summary: Learn how Kai Brach has overcome the hurdles to publishing an indie print magazine and managed to build a one-man operation that sustains him full-time.

entry.title: SendPulse - Maximizing Email Open Rates ($200000/mo)
entry.summary: Constantine Rozenshtraus thought tools in the email marketing industry were solving the wrong problem. Learn how he's grown his own solution to $200,000/mo.

entry.title: UX Power Tools - Sketch Design Framework and UI Kit ($16000/mo)
entry.summary: How Christian Beck and Jon Moore combined their desire to make passive income with the skills they've picked up on the job to create a viable business.

entry.title: Ladder - Growth Marketing Agency + Tech ($200000/mo)
entry.summary: Jon Brody explains how the data-driven decision-making skills he learned as a professional poker player helped him grow his agency's revenue to $200,000/mo.

entry.title: NinjaOutreach - Lead Prospecting and Outreach Tool ($50000/mo)
entry.summary: Dave Schneider explains how he broke through a long plateau of revenue stagnation and went on to grow his business to $50,000/month.

entry.title: UXClub.com - Learning Platform for UX Designers ($450/mo)
entry.summary: Ed Vinicombe explains how he turned a skill he already had into a profitable side project by avoiding common mistakes made by others in the industry.

entry.title: Cronometer - Nutrition Tracker ($40000/mo)
entry.summary: Learn how a little bit of patience and a very solid product helped Aaron Davidson turn his small side project into a business that does $40,000/mo in revenue.

entry.title: KidGenius - Management Software for Childcare ($300/mo)
entry.summary: Craig Pearce knew nothing about the childcare industry except that it had little online presence. Read how he engaged with his first users to grow to $300/mo.

entry.title: Conscious Apps - App Development with a Purpose ($1000/mo)
entry.summary: Martin Adams discusses the technical challenges he overcame to build and eventually sell a $10 app to over 20,000 customers on the App Store.

entry.title: Discourse - Forum / Community Website Software ($120000/mo)
entry.summary: "Sell to people who have money!" Jeff Atwood explains how targeting high-value businesses instead of consumers helped grow Discourse's revenue to $120,000/mo.

entry.title: Weather Extension - Best Way to Check the Weather ($2500/mo)
entry.summary: Tim Leland talks about how sharing helpful knowledge on his blog helped him build an audience and grow his app's revenue to $2,500/month.

entry.title: BugTower - Simple Bug Tracking Web App ($820/mo)
entry.summary: Kyle Connors explains how he grew his side project to $800/mo by identifying the challenges that kept him from finishing and launching his products in the past.

entry.title: RecurPost - Smart Social Media Management ($4000/mo)
entry.summary: After struggling to find an audience in the past, Dinesh Agarwal narrowed his focus to a simple problem, reached out to customers 1-on-1, and grew to $4,000/month.

entry.title: Salem Software - Spanish Language Bible iOS App ($10000/mo)
entry.summary: Trevor McKendrick explains how he identified a gap in the market, continuously adapted his business model, and grew his mobile app's revenue to $10,000/month.

entry.title: Gifty Weddings - Simple Wedding Gift Registry ($150/mo)
entry.summary: Learn how Ben Hoyt's side project has helped him pay the bills for almost 10 years.

entry.title: Lighting Shoes - Shopify Store for LED Shoes ($10000/mo)
entry.summary: Dan Rusu bought an e-commerce company he knew nothing about. Read how savvy marketing has put it on track to double its revenue in less than two months.

entry.title: The UI Audit - Web Application Design Book ($1200/mo)
entry.summary: In 2015, web design expert Jane Portman decided not to take any more consulting jobs. Learn how she turned her knowledge into a book that makes $1,200/mo.

entry.title: AppToolkit.io - Marketing Tools for App Developers ($1000/mo)
entry.summary: Ross Rojek and his wife Heidi talk about using open-source code and a variety of marketing channels to build a suite of profitable apps for mobile developers.

entry.title: SaferVPN - The Fastest and Simplest VPN ($20000/mo)
entry.summary: Learn about the numerous product and marketing strategies Sagi Gidali and Amit Bareket used to grow their VPN business' revenue to well over $20,000/month.

entry.title: Snappa - Graphic Design Tool ($26240/mo)
entry.summary: Learn how Christopher Gimmer uses low-cost marketing strategies to generate $26,000/month in revenue from lots of customers at a low price point.

entry.title: Hacker News Books - Top Books from Hacker News ($300/mo)
entry.summary: Ivan Delchev explains how he validated a hunch and then used automation to create a product that generates $300 per month in passive income.

entry.title: Cash Overflow - Personal Finance Blog ($3000/mo)
entry.summary: Starting a newsletter or a blog? Learn how Pardeep Goyal makes $3,000 a month by creating high quality content for a small group of motivated subscribers.

entry.title: AccelerList - Amazon Product Listing ($2400/mo)
entry.summary: Travis R. explains how he found his first paying customers by knowing where they hung out online and by focusing exclusively on features that they'd find valuable.

entry.title: Workshop - Leads for Designers + Developers ($12000/mo)
entry.summary: Robert Williams describes how he generated $3000 MRR in his first week by solving his own problem and quickly creating a landing page for a low-tech prototype.

entry.title: Queryfeed - Social Network Grabber ($150/mo)
entry.summary: Ivan Grishaev talks about building an app that he loves, generating recurring revenue, and reducing churn by talking to customers.

entry.title: MyClean - You Click. We Clean. You Relax. ($750000/mo)
entry.summary: Michael Scharf explains how he grew revenue to $750,000/month by ignoring VC pressure to grow rapidly and focusing instead on sustainability and quality.

entry.title: Founderkit - Reviews on Startup Tools ($5000/mo)
entry.summary: Learn how Ryan Mickle and Ian Hunter turned their prototype into a product, reached out to customers, and grew to $5000/mo just two months after launch.

entry.title: Amplifr - Social Media Scheduling and Analytics ($15500/mo)
entry.summary: Nate Gadzhibalaev's shows you how to turn consulting revenue into a $16,000/mo product, and how to use ads to avoid spending years on a product doomed to fail.

entry.title: Insomnia - Graphical API Client ($800/mo)
entry.summary: Gregory Schier talks about growing his apps monthly recurring revenue, his journey toward financial independence, and why it's crucial to learn to finish what you start.

entry.title: Less Annoying CRM - Simple CRM for Small Businesses ($120000/mo)
entry.summary: Tyler King explains how he's grown revenue to $120,000/mo by focusing on product quality, prioritizing customer support, and being patient where others might rush.

entry.title: Anatomonics - Anatomy Memorization System ($800/mo)
entry.summary: Michael Benkovich describes how he used keyword research to develop an idea, a landing page to validate it, and YouTube to attract a stready stream of customers.

entry.title: Marketing for Developers - Course for Indie Programmers ($10000/mo)
entry.summary: Learn how Justin Jackson built an audience and used an email launch sequence to make $20,000 from his popular book-course combo, Marketing for Developers.

entry.title: Iconic - WooCommerce Plugins ($4100/mo)
entry.summary: James Kemp's collection of WooCommerce plugins earn $4100/mo. Learn how he's finding customers via content marketing and store-based distribution channels.

entry.title: wallabag.it - Save Articles for Later ($600/mo)
entry.summary: Nicolas Lœuillet talks about how he's making money from his open-source app by charging for an easy-to-use version for privacy-conscious users.

entry.title: Videoder - Video & Music Downloader ($12000/mo)
entry.summary: Surbhi Singla talks about growing to over 30 million downloads by targeting a global audience, getting social media right, and doubling down on product quality.

entry.title: ConvertKit - Email Marketing for Bloggers ($597000/mo)
entry.summary: In 2013, Nathan Barry challenged himself to start a software company. Today, ConvertKit generates $600,000 every month. Here's how he did it.

entry.title: Designhill - Leading Graphic Design Marketplace ($110000/mo)
entry.summary: The Aggarwal brothers explain how they bootstrapped their marketplace to $1.3M ARR by talking to customers, writing shareable content, and relentlessly A/B testing.

entry.title: SelfDecode - Digital Health Coach with Genetics ($16900/mo)
entry.summary: Alan Warsoff and Joe Cohen make $17,000/month analyzing people's genes and providing lifestyle recommendations. Learn how they built and grew their business.

entry.title: Photon - Solar Panel Installation App ($1000/mo)
entry.summary: Photon co-founder Andy Qin talks about building an app for the solar industry, learning from their customers, and growing revenue to $1,000/month.

entry.title: Ghost - Professional Publishing Platform ($62000/mo)
entry.summary: John O'Nolan talks about getting 30,000 mailing list signups, raising $300,000 on Kickstarter, and growing his open-source publishing platform to $750,000/year.

entry.title: mugpods - Nespresso Compatible Pods ($15000/mo)
entry.summary: Jack Bramhall describes how he sourced a world-first product and then continually re-invested profits to bootstrap sales to over $15,000/mo.

entry.title: Cronitor.io - Monitor Scheduled Tasks and Services ($6000/mo)
entry.summary: August Flanagan explains how he identified a simple problem, built a barebones solution on the side, found customers, and grew revenue to $6000/mo.

entry.title: Vettery - Talent Marketplace ($null/mo)
entry.summary: Adam Goldstein explains how Vettery has grown to 10,000+ job applications/month by bringing new technology and creative marketing to the aging recruiting industry.

entry.title: IdeaCheck.io - Idea Validation Tool ($1500/mo)
entry.summary: Nick Fischer is using his PhD knowledge to help investors and businesses evaluate their ideas. Learn how he's found customers and grown revenue to $1500/mo.

entry.title: Compelling Science Fiction - Online Science Fiction Magazine ($900/mo)
